code: ### 1. State enrollment grew 28% since 2002  State added 68,000 students from 2002 to 2026, bucking national trends.  ```r library(arschooldata) library(dplyr)  enr <- fetch_enr_multi(2002:2026)  enr %>%   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   select(end_year, n_students) %>%   filter(end_year %in% c(2002, 2026)) %>%   mutate(change = n_students - lag(n_students),          pct_change = round((n_students / lag(n_students) - 1) * 100, 1)) # Prints: 2002=XXX, 2026=YYY, change=ZZZ, pct=PP.P% ---  ## Vignette Caching (REQUIRED)  All packages use knitr chunk caching to speed up vignette builds and CI.  ### Three-Part Caching Approach  **1. Enable knitr caching in setup chunks:** ```r ```{r setup, include=FALSE} knitr::opts_chunk$set(   echo = TRUE,   message = FALSE,   warning = FALSE,   cache = TRUE ) **2. Use cache in fetch calls:** ```r enr <- fetch_enr(2024, use_cache = TRUE) enr_multi <- fetch_enr_multi(2020:2024, use_cache = TRUE)

what: 1. Hawaii is America’s only statewide school district
title: Hawaii Enrollment Trends
text: Unlike every state, Hawaii operates single statewide school district approximately 290 schools. local school boards, property tax funding. One state, one system.
code: statewide <- enr_current %>%   filter(type == "STATE", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   select(n_students)  # Count counties (Hawaii is organized by county, not individual schools in this data) n_counties <- enr_current %>%   filter(type == "COUNTY", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   nrow()  cat("Total students:", format(statewide$n_students, big.mark = ","), "\n") #> Total students: 167,076 cat("Counties served:", n_counties, "(plus Charter Schools)\n") #> Counties served: 4 (plus Charter Schools)

what: 2. Enrollment has been declining for a decade
title: Hawaii Enrollment Trends
text: Hawaii lost 15,000 students since 2015. High housing costs push families mainland, birth rates falling.
code: state_trend <- enr %>%   filter(type == "STATE", grade_level == "TOTAL")  ggplot(state_trend, aes(x = end_year, y = n_students)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1.5, color = colors["total"]) +   geom_point(size = 3, color = colors["total"]) +   scale_y_continuous(labels = comma, limits = c(0, NA)) +   labs(title = "Hawaii Public School Enrollment",        subtitle = "Declining as families move to the mainland",        x = "School Year", y = "Students") +   theme_readme()

title: Hawaii Enrollment Trends
text: Hawaii’s single statewide district serves four counties plus charter schools. Honolulu (Oahu) dominates n_students, two-thirds students.
code: county_enr <- enr_current %>%   filter(grade_level == "TOTAL", type %in% c("COUNTY", "CHARTER")) %>%   mutate(county_label = reorder(county_name, -n_students))  ggplot(county_enr, aes(x = county_label, y = n_students)) +   geom_col(fill = colors["total"]) +   scale_y_continuous(labels = comma) +   labs(title = "Hawaii Enrollment by County",        subtitle = "Honolulu dominates with two-thirds of students",        x = "", y = "Students") +   theme_readme() +   theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1))

title: Hawaii Enrollment Trends
text: pandemic struck, families moved mainland shifted private schools. Hawaii saw significant n_students drops across counties.
code: # Show year-over-year change during COVID covid_change <- enr %>%   filter(end_year %in% c(2020, 2021), grade_level == "TOTAL", type == "STATE") %>%   select(end_year, n_students)  if (nrow(covid_change) == 2) {   change <- diff(covid_change$n_students)   pct_change <- change / covid_change$n_students[1] * 100   cat("Enrollment change 2020-2021:", format(change, big.mark = ","),       sprintf("(%.1f%%)", pct_change), "\n") } #> Enrollment change 2020-2021: -4,647 (-2.6%)

what: 5. Kindergarten is shrinking faster than high school
title: Hawaii Enrollment Trends
text: Hawaii’s kindergarten n_students dropped years. pipeline students entering system narrowing.
code: k_trend <- enr %>%   filter(type == "STATE", grade_level %in% c("K", "09", "12")) %>%   mutate(grade_label = case_when(     grade_level == "K" ~ "Kindergarten",     grade_level == "09" ~ "Grade 9",     grade_level == "12" ~ "Grade 12"   ))  ggplot(k_trend, aes(x = end_year, y = n_students, color = grade_label)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1.2) +   geom_point(size = 2.5) +   scale_y_continuous(labels = comma) +   labs(title = "Kindergarten Shrinking Faster Than High School",        subtitle = "The pipeline of students is narrowing",        x = "School Year", y = "Students", color = "") +   theme_readme()

text: Hawaii’s charter school n_students increasing alternative traditional public schools managed statewide district.
code: charter_trend <- enr %>%   filter(type == "CHARTER", grade_level == "TOTAL")  ggplot(charter_trend, aes(x = end_year, y = n_students)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1.5, color = colors["total"]) +   geom_point(size = 3, color = colors["total"]) +   scale_y_continuous(labels = comma, limits = c(0, NA)) +   labs(title = "Charter School Enrollment",        subtitle = "Growing alternative to traditional public schools",        x = "School Year", y = "Students") +   theme_readme()

title: Hawaii Enrollment Trends
text: county shows n_students trend. Honolulu (Oahu) dominates overall n_students seen largest absolute decline.
code: county_trend <- enr %>%   filter(grade_level == "TOTAL", type == "COUNTY")  ggplot(county_trend, aes(x = end_year, y = n_students, color = county_name)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1.2) +   geom_point(size = 2.5) +   scale_y_continuous(labels = comma) +   labs(title = "Enrollment by County",        subtitle = "Honolulu dominates but all counties affected by decline",        x = "School Year", y = "Students", color = "") +   theme_readme()

title: Hawaii Enrollment Trends
text: Hawaii tracks special education n_students separately regular grades DBEDT data.
code:
sped <- enr_current %>%   filter(type == "STATE", grade_level == "SPED")  if (nrow(sped) > 0) {   total <- enr_current %>%     filter(type == "STATE", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%     pull(n_students)   cat("Special education students:", format(sped$n_students, big.mark = ","), "
")   cat("Percent of total n_students:", sprintf("%.1f%%", sped$n_students / total * 100), "
") } else {   cat("Special education data not separately reported for this year.
") } #> Special education data not separately reported for this year.

title: Hawaii Enrollment Trends
text: Hawaii’s n_students grade shows typical K-12 distribution, kindergarten serving entry point system.
code: grade_dist <- enr_current %>%   filter(type == "STATE", !grade_level %in% c("TOTAL", "SPED")) %>%   mutate(grade_level = factor(grade_level, levels = c("PK", "K", sprintf("%02d", 1:12))))  ggplot(grade_dist, aes(x = grade_level, y = n_students)) +   geom_col(fill = colors["total"]) +   scale_y_continuous(labels = comma) +   labs(title = "Enrollment by Grade Level",        subtitle = paste("Hawaii Public Schools,", max_year),        x = "Grade", y = "Students") +   theme_readme()

what: 11. Honolulu dominates but neighbor islands hold stronger
title: Hawaii Enrollment Trends
text: Honolulu County (Oahu) two-thirds students, neighbor island counties maintained n_students effectively statewide decline.
code: island_comparison <- enr %>%   filter(grade_level == "TOTAL", type == "COUNTY") %>%   mutate(island_group = ifelse(county_name == "Honolulu", "Honolulu (Oahu)", "Neighbor Islands")) %>%   group_by(end_year, island_group) %>%   summarize(n_students = sum(n_students, na.rm = TRUE), .groups = "drop")  ggplot(island_comparison, aes(x = end_year, y = n_students, color = island_group)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1.5) +   geom_point(size = 3) +   scale_y_continuous(labels = comma, limits = c(0, NA)) +   scale_color_manual(values = c("Honolulu (Oahu)" = "#2C3E50", "Neighbor Islands" = "#1ABC9C")) +   labs(title = "Honolulu vs Neighbor Islands",        subtitle = "Oahu dominates but faces steeper decline",        x = "School Year", y = "Students", color = "") +   theme_readme()

what: 12. Elementary schools losing students faster than high schools
title: Hawaii Enrollment Trends
text: Elementary grades (K-5) seen steeper n_students declines secondary grades (6-12), reflecting declining birth rates past decade.
code: level_comparison <- enr %>%   filter(type == "STATE", !grade_level %in% c("TOTAL", "SPED", "PK")) %>%   mutate(level = case_when(     grade_level %in% c("K", "01", "02", "03", "04", "05") ~ "Elementary (K-5)",     grade_level %in% c("06", "07", "08") ~ "Middle (6-8)",     TRUE ~ "High School (9-12)"   )) %>%   group_by(end_year, level) %>%   summarize(n_students = sum(n_students, na.rm = TRUE), .groups = "drop")  ggplot(level_comparison, aes(x = end_year, y = n_students, color = level)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1.2) +   geom_point(size = 2.5) +   scale_y_continuous(labels = comma) +   scale_color_manual(values = c(     "Elementary (K-5)" = "#3498DB",     "Middle (6-8)" = "#F39C12",     "High School (9-12)" = "#E74C3C"   )) +   labs(title = "Enrollment by School Level",        subtitle = "Elementary schools losing students faster than high schools",        x = "School Year", y = "Students", color = "") +   theme_readme()

what: 13. Maui’s tourism economy shows in school n_students
title: Hawaii Enrollment Trends
text: Maui County seen n_students fluctuations tied tourism-dependent economy. 2023 wildfires added new challenges already changing population.
code: maui_trend <- enr %>%   filter(grade_level == "TOTAL", county_name == "Maui")  ggplot(maui_trend, aes(x = end_year, y = n_students)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1.5, color = "#9B59B6") +   geom_point(size = 3, color = "#9B59B6") +   scale_y_continuous(labels = comma, limits = c(0, NA)) +   labs(title = "Maui County Enrollment",        subtitle = "Tourism economy and population shifts affect n_students",        x = "School Year", y = "Students") +   theme_readme()

title: Hawaii Enrollment Trends
text: Pre-Kindergarten n_students provides early signal elementary schools see coming years. Hawaii’s Pre-K numbers show declining pipeline.
code: prek_trend <- enr %>%   filter(type == "STATE", grade_level == "PK")  if (nrow(prek_trend) > 0 && sum(prek_trend$n_students, na.rm = TRUE) > 0) {   ggplot(prek_trend, aes(x = end_year, y = n_students)) +     geom_line(linewidth = 1.5, color = "#1ABC9C") +     geom_point(size = 3, color = "#1ABC9C") +     scale_y_continuous(labels = comma, limits = c(0, NA)) +     labs(title = "Pre-Kindergarten Enrollment",          subtitle = "Early indicator of future elementary n_students",          x = "School Year", y = "Students") +     theme_readme() } else {   cat("Pre-K data not available or all zeros in the data range.\n") }

what: 15. Big Island holds largest neighbor island n_students
title: Hawaii Enrollment Trends
text: Hawaii County (Big Island) largest student population outside Oahu, serving rural communities across geographic area larger Hawaiian islands combined.
code: neighbor_comparison <- enr_current %>%   filter(grade_level == "TOTAL", type == "COUNTY", county_name != "Honolulu") %>%   mutate(county_label = reorder(county_name, -n_students))  ggplot(neighbor_comparison, aes(x = county_label, y = n_students)) +   geom_col(fill = "#E74C3C") +   geom_text(aes(label = comma(n_students)), vjust = -0.5, size = 4) +   scale_y_continuous(labels = comma, expand = expansion(mult = c(0, 0.15))) +   labs(title = "Neighbor Island Enrollment",        subtitle = "Hawaii County (Big Island) leads outside Oahu",        x = "", y = "Students") +   theme_readme()

title: Introduction to hischooldata
text: hischooldata package provides simple interface accessing Hawaii public school enrollment data Hawaii Department Education (HIDOE) Hawaii State Department Business, Economic Development & Tourism (DBEDT) State Data Book.

title: Introduction to hischooldata
text: Unlike U.S. states, Hawaii single statewide school district. Hawaii Department Education operates public schools across entire state, organized four counties: Honolulu (Oahu) - approximately 62% total enrollment Hawaii County (Big Island) - approximately 13% enrollment Maui (includes Molokai Lanai) - approximately 11% enrollment Kauai - approximately 5% enrollment Charter Schools - approximately 8% enrollment (statewide) single-district structure means data naturally organized county level rather school district level found states.

title: Introduction to hischooldata
code: # Install from GitHub # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("almartin82/hischooldata")

title: Introduction to hischooldata
text: main function fetch_enr(), downloads enrollment data specific school year:
code: library(hischooldata)  # Get 2024 enrollment data (2023-24 school year) enr_2024 <- fetch_enr(2024, use_cache = TRUE) head(enr_2024) #>   end_year district_id                  district_name county_name  type #> 1     2024          HI Hawaii Department of Education State Total STATE #> 2     2024          HI Hawaii Department of Education State Total STATE #> 3     2024          HI Hawaii Department of Education State Total STATE #> 4     2024          HI Hawaii Department of Education State Total STATE #> 5     2024          HI Hawaii Department of Education State Total STATE #> 6     2024          HI Hawaii Department of Education State Total STATE #>   grade_level         subgroup n_students pct aggregation_flag is_state #> 1       TOTAL total_enrollment     169308  NA            state     TRUE #> 2          PK total_enrollment       1659  NA            state     TRUE #> 3           K total_enrollment      11963  NA            state     TRUE #> 4          01 total_enrollment      13060  NA            state     TRUE #> 5          02 total_enrollment      13300  NA            state     TRUE #> 6          03 total_enrollment      12869  NA            state     TRUE #>   is_county is_charter #> 1     FALSE      FALSE #> 2     FALSE      FALSE #> 3     FALSE      FALSE #> 4     FALSE      FALSE #> 5     FALSE      FALSE #> 6     FALSE      FALSE

title: Introduction to hischooldata
text: end_year parameter represents END school year: end_year = 2024 means 2023-24 school year (ending June 2024) end_year = 2025 means 2024-25 school year (ending June 2025) convention consistent state schooldata packages.

title: Introduction to hischooldata
text: Use get_available_years() see years available: Note: School year 2011-12 (end_year = 2012) available 2011 DBEDT State Data Book published.
code: get_available_years() #> $min_year #> [1] 2011 #>  #> $max_year #> [1] 2025 #>  #> $years #>  [1] 2011 2013 2014 2015 2016 2017 2018 2019 2020 2021 2022 2023 2024 2025 #>  #> $description #> [1] "Hawaii enrollment data is available for school years ending 2011 to 2025 (except 2012 - no 2011 Data Book published)"

title: Introduction to hischooldata
text: returned data frame includes:

title: Introduction to hischooldata
code: library(dplyr) library(ggplot2)  # Get recent years enr_multi <- fetch_enr_multi(2020:2024, use_cache = TRUE)  # Calculate county totals over time county_trends <- enr_multi |>   filter(type == "COUNTY", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   select(end_year, county_name, n_students)  # Plot trends ggplot(county_trends, aes(x = end_year, y = n_students, color = county_name)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1) +   geom_point() +   labs(     title = "Hawaii Public School Enrollment by County",     x = "School Year End",     y = "Total Enrollment",     color = "County"   ) +   scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::comma) +   theme_minimal()

title: Introduction to hischooldata
code: # Get state-level enrollment by grade enr_2024 <- fetch_enr(2024, use_cache = TRUE) state_grades <- enr_2024 |>   filter(type == "STATE", grade_level != "TOTAL") |>   mutate(grade_level = factor(grade_level, levels = c("PK", "K", sprintf("%02d", 1:12), "SPED")))  # Plot grade distribution ggplot(state_grades, aes(x = grade_level, y = n_students)) +   geom_col(fill = "steelblue") +   labs(     title = "Hawaii Public School Enrollment by Grade (2023-24)",     x = "Grade Level",     y = "Enrollment"   ) +   scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::comma) +   theme_minimal() +   theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1))

title: Introduction to hischooldata
text: package caches downloaded data locally avoid repeated downloads:
code: # Check cache status cache_status()  # Clear cache for a specific year clear_cache(2024)  # Clear all cached data clear_cache()

title: Introduction to hischooldata
text: package fetches data : URL: https://files.hawaii.gov/dbedt/economic/databook/ Contains county-level enrollment grade URL: https://www.hawaiipublicschools.org/ Contains school-level detail (available)

title: Introduction to hischooldata
text: 2011-12 Data: 2011 DBEDT Data Book published, end_year = 2012 available. SPED Data: Special Education enrollment shown separately years suppressed 2024-25 data (per 2024 Data Book footnote). Multi-Year Tables: 2021 Data Book contains 2020-21 2021-22 school year data. package handles extraction correct year. COVID Impact: 2019 2020 Data Books contain 2019-20 school year data (2020 Data Book duplicate due COVID disruptions).

title: Introduction to hischooldata
text: Python package also available accessing data: See pyhischooldata/ directory Python implementation.
code: # pip install hischooldata  from hischooldata import fetch_enr  df = fetch_enr(2024, use_cache = TRUE) print(df.head())

title: Getting Started with hischooldata
text: hischooldata provides simple, consistent interface accessing Hawaii school enrollment data Hawaii Department Education (HIDOE) via DBEDT State Data Book.

title: Getting Started with hischooldata
code: # Install from GitHub remotes::install_github("almartin82/hischooldata")

title: Getting Started with hischooldata
text: main function fetch_enr() downloads enrollment data specific school year.
code: library(hischooldata) library(dplyr)  # Fetch 2024 enrollment data (2023-24 school year) enr <- fetch_enr(2024, use_cache = TRUE)  # View the structure glimpse(enr) ## Rows: 90 ## Columns: 13 ## $ end_year         <dbl> 2024, 2024, 2024, 2024, 2024, 2024, 2024, 2024, 2024,… ## $ district_id      <chr> "HI", "HI", "HI", "HI", "HI", "HI", "HI", "HI", "HI",… ## $ district_name    <chr> "Hawaii Department of Education", "Hawaii Department … ## $ county_name      <chr> "State Total", "State Total", "State Total", "State T… ## $ type             <chr> "STATE", "STATE", "STATE", "STATE", "STATE", "STATE",… ## $ grade_level      <chr> "TOTAL", "PK", "K", "01", "02", "03", "04", "05", "06… ## $ subgroup         <chr> "total_enrollment", "total_enrollment", "total_enroll… ## $ n_students       <dbl> 169308, 1659, 11963, 13060, 13300, 12869, 13456, 1381… ## $ pct              <dbl> NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, N… ## $ aggregation_flag <chr> "state", "state", "state", "state", "state", "state",… ## $ is_state         <lgl> TRUE, TRUE, TRUE, TRUE, TRUE, TRUE, TRUE, TRUE, TRUE,… ## $ is_county        <lgl> FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, FALS… ## $ is_charter       <lgl> FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, FALS…

title: Getting Started with hischooldata
text: Check years available:
code: get_available_years() ## $min_year ## [1] 2011 ##  ## $max_year ## [1] 2025 ##  ## $years ##  [1] 2011 2013 2014 2015 2016 2017 2018 2019 2020 2021 2022 2023 2024 2025 ##  ## $description ## [1] "Hawaii enrollment data is available for school years ending 2011 to 2025 (except 2012 - no 2011 Data Book published)"

title: Getting Started with hischooldata
text: Fetch data multiple years :
code: # Fetch 3 years of data enr_multi <- fetch_enr_multi(2022:2024, use_cache = TRUE)  # Count rows per year enr_multi %>%   count(end_year) ##   end_year  n ## 1     2022 96 ## 2     2023 96 ## 3     2024 90

title: Getting Started with hischooldata
text: Hawaii four counties: Hawaii, Honolulu, Kauai, Maui:
code: enr %>%   filter(type == "COUNTY", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   select(county_name, n_students) %>%   arrange(desc(n_students)) ##     county_name n_students ## 1      Honolulu     105712 ## 2 Hawaii County      22880 ## 3          Maui      19541 ## 4         Kauai       8729

title: Getting Started with hischooldata
text: package caches downloaded data speed repeated fetches:
code: # View cached files cache_status()  # Clear all cache clear_cache()  # Clear specific year clear_cache(2024)

previous_headings: What can you find with hischooldata?
what: 1. Hawaii is America’s only statewide school district
title: Hawaii School Data
text: Unlike every state, Hawaii operates single statewide school district. local school boards, property tax funding. One state, one system.
code: library(hischooldata) library(dplyr)  enr_2024 <- fetch_enr(2024)  enr_2024 %>%   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL", subgroup == "total_enrollment") %>%   select(n_students) #>   n_students #> 1     169308

previous_headings: What can you find with hischooldata?

title: Hawaii School Data

title: Hawaii School Data
code: import pyhischooldata as hi  # Fetch one year enr_2024 = hi.fetch_enr(2024)  # Fetch multiple years enr_recent = hi.fetch_enr_multi([2020, 2021, 2022, 2023, 2024])  # Statewide totals enr_2024[     (enr_2024['is_state'] == True) &     (enr_2024['subgroup'] == 'total_enrollment') &     (enr_2024['grade_level'] == 'TOTAL') ]  # County breakdown (enr_2024[     (enr_2024['is_county'] == True) &     (enr_2024['grade_level'] == 'TOTAL') &     (enr_2024['subgroup'] == 'total_enrollment') ] .sort_values('n_students', ascending=False) [['county_name', 'n_students']])  # School-level detail (enr_2024[     (enr_2024['subgroup'] == 'total_enrollment') &     (enr_2024['grade_level'] == 'TOTAL') ] .sort_values('n_students', ascending=False) [['district_name', 'n_students']])

title: Get available years for Hawaii enrollment data — get_available_years
code: get_available_years()

title: Get available years for Hawaii enrollment data — get_available_years
text: list components: min_year Earliest available year (2011) max_year recent available year (2025) years Vector available years description Human-readable description date range

title: Get available years for Hawaii enrollment data — get_available_years
text: end_year parameter follows convention represents END year school year. example: end_year = 2024 means 2023-24 school year (ending June 2024) end_year = 2025 means 2024-25 school year (ending June 2025) Note data sources: DBEDT Data Books published annually typically contain enrollment data school year ends publication year. example, 2023 Data Book contains 2023-24 school year data (end_year=2024). Known gaps: end_year 2012 available (2011 Data Book published) end_year 2020 appears 2019 2020 Data Books (COVID impact)

title: Get available years for Hawaii enrollment data — get_available_years
code: get_available_years() #> $min_year #> [1] 2011 #>  #> $max_year #> [1] 2025 #>  #> $years #>  [1] 2011 2013 2014 2015 2016 2017 2018 2019 2020 2021 2022 2023 2024 2025 #>  #> $description #> [1] "Hawaii enrollment data is available for school years ending 2011 to 2025 (except 2012 - no 2011 Data Book published)" #>

title: Transform enrollment data to tidy format — tidy_enr
text: df Data frame raw enrollment data (get_raw_enr())

title: Transform enrollment data to tidy format — tidy_enr
text: Data frame standard tidy format columns: end_year School year end (2024 = 2023-24 school year) district_id State identifier (HI Hawaii - single district state) district_name District name (Hawaii Department Education) county_name County name (Honolulu, Hawaii County, Maui, Kauai, State Total, Charter Schools) type Aggregation level (STATE, COUNTY, CHARTER) grade_level Grade level (TOTAL, PK, K, 01-12, SPED) subgroup Demographic subgroup ("total_enrollment" available) n_students Student count pct Percentage (NA Hawaii - demographic data) aggregation_flag Aggregation level ("state" "district") is_state Logical TRUE state-level rows is_county Logical TRUE county-level rows is_charter Logical TRUE charter school aggregate rows

title: Transform enrollment data to tidy format — tidy_enr
text: tidy format one row per (entity, grade_level, subgroup) combination, making easy filter, group, analyze.
